column5: Fours hours freezing my ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, and caught this one in the last of of the fourth hour.    I had to chip the ice off my float about 10 times.Thats cold.
Nice chrome Brian   It's all worth it in the end Great job my friend
Nice One. Good thing you toughed it out
one is better then what I got today  and it took me 2 hours of driving to get there

Thanks fellas. I got that one in a pool I have fished alot and never got a thing from it. I decided to fish it, cause the sun was hitting that bend and it warmed me up.LOL  I have never fished this late on the river,even back when I use to do it alot. It,s tough conditions and the bite is real slow. Looking at the forcast this week,it may get a bit dirty for the comeing weekend. If Simcoe dont harden up soon,guess this will be my choice. Not that Im complaining.
I,ll bet the 20 minute drive yesterday felt better.LOL  Check in with me Monday bud.
Right on.  Nice chromer.  Makes it worth freezing your  cheeks off!

Good on ya!!! I remember back in the day I would hit the river every chance I got. I particularly remember one frosty February day. Was fishing in -10 temps and standing on an ice shelf in my floater suit and warm boots when the shelf gave way and I ended up in the river!!! I climbed out and continued fishing for about 3 more hours and never had a hit!!! I also couldn't get the two frozen blocks of ice that used to be my boots off either.
Good one Brian. 4 hours freezing is better than 4 hours working!
